Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir

Lúcio Antônio de Santa Ana, soldier of the 3rd Battalion of Hunters, who fell ill at the Padre Feliciano estate, when this battalion was marching to join the forces coming from Rio Grande, was taken prisoner on the 25th of last November, when the rebel force led by Agostinho was defeated, and, as I was informed of these circumstances, I removed him from among the other prisoners to deliver him to the battalion; and I now present him to Your Excellency.

God preserve Your Excellency  
Camp at Restinga Seca, December 8, 1841.  

Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir Antônio Correia Seara,  
Interim Brigadier Commander of the Forces in Operations.  

Francisco Manuel Accioli,  
Interim Captain Commander.
